visualization_prompt: Generate a bellcurve chart showing normal distribution with standard deviation zones using gradient color encoding and statistical annotations

title.text: Bell Curve with Standard Deviation Zones

visualization_explanation:
The dataset contains two-dimensional continuous numerical data representing a normal distribution (μ=3, σ=0.5) with synthetic scatter points demonstrating empirical distribution. Synthetic data follows mathematical normal distribution properties with 68% of values within 1σ, 95% within 2σ, and 99.7% within 3σ.

The bell curve visualization employs Tufte's data-ink maximization through clean gridlines and minimal chart junk. Cairo's perceptual principles are implemented through sequential color gradients for standard deviation zones (light to dark blue) and pre-attentive marker differentiation for scatter points. Statistical validity is maintained with μ=3 and σ=0.5 in synthetic data generation, while the zone annotations directly reference empirical rule percentages.
